#summary Hawkscope Plugin Developer Guide
#labels Phase-Implementation

So, you want to write a Hawkscope Plugin? You are in a right place then.

== Anatomy of a Plugin ==
Hawkscope Plugin is a Java JAR file, which contains:
  * plugin.loader - a plain-text file with fully qualified class name of main plugin class.
  * Java Class that implements [http://hawkscope.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/src/main/java/com/varaneckas/hawkscope/plugin/Plugin.java com.varaneckas.hawkscope.plugin.Plugin] interface. For convenience, it is recommended to extend [http://hawkscope.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/src/main/java/com/varaneckas/hawkscope/plugin/PluginAdapter.java PluginAdapter], which allows you to implement only the functionality you will need.
  * Image resources in "images" folder. (optional)
  * Any other Java classes or resources. (optional)

Hawkscope plugins should be compiled with Java 1.5 compatibility.

== The Bare Minimum ==
[http://lh3.ggpht.com/_nP8Aa6cTHpo/SZ0rYiF7FAI/AAAAAAAABVY/M5iotSSwKb8/hs8.png]

`plugin.loader`
{{{
bare.MinimumPlugin
}}}

`bare/MinimumPlugin.java`
{{{
package bare;

import com.varaneckas.hawkscope.plugin.PluginAdapter;

class MinimumPlugin extends PluginAdapter {
    
    public String getDescription() {
        return "Bare Minimum Plugin";
    }

    public String getName() {
        return "Bare Minimum";
    }

    public String getVersion() {
        return "1.0";
    }
}
}}}
